page.title: 14Brenchley Telephone Exchange
page.content: The Exchange was built in{1965}and serves the area of{Brenchley,Matfield, {Petteridge,Castle Hill}and{Horsmonden. Here subscribers are allocated their number and their meters are read.The engineer works between here and {Wadhurst,}the alarms for faults being switched through to{Tunbridge Wells when the exchange is unmanned. He starts work at{8.30}and finishes at{4.45.}He must wear goggles and a special apron while dealing with the batteries,and hand protectors while working on the lines. He likes his work,especially being his own boss and the{responsibility} this entails.He would not like to be{ one of the crowd by working in town. Unless retrained he could be made {redundant,}because{1993}sees the introduction of{"System X"}when the exchange will be fully{automated.
